definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Flea markets came into being in China only several years ago.
sentences.chinese: 僅幾年前中國纔開始有了跳蚤市場。

sentences.english: The metal stand next to the desk is a local flea market find.
sentences.chinese: 桌子旁邊的金屬架子是在本地的跳蚤市場買的。

sentences.english: I got the rare edition of the book for a song in the flea market.
sentences.chinese: 我在跳蚤市場上以極低的價錢買到了這本書的孤本。

sentences.english: Aside from the bargains, flea markets always have a great atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 除了撿便宜，逛跳蚤市場最有趣的是感受人情味。

sentences.english: These offer a different breed of bargain than flea markets.
sentences.chinese: 這裏提供了比跳蚤市場不同種類的商品。

sentences.english: She set out to sell it, first a few at flea markets.
sentences.chinese: 她決定首先到跳蚤市場去賣她的拖布。

sentences.english: the stool was a flea market find.
sentences.chinese: 圓凳是跳蚤市場上淘的。

sentences.english: The Bugatti print is from a flea market.
In addition to going to flea markets, Xiao likes online shopping.
sentences.chinese: 除了跳蚤市場以外，肖樂也喜歡網上購物。

sentences.english: To Sadie, China seemed like one giant flea market.
sentences.chinese: 對莎蒂而言，中國就像一個巨大的跳蚤市場。

sentences.english: Also flea markets are popular, too.
sentences.chinese: 同樣地，跳蚤市場也很受歡迎。

sentences.english: The market square creates a frame for farmer's markets and flea markets.
sentences.chinese: 市場區爲農貿市場和跳蚤市場創造了一個空間。

sentences.english: Hunter have an interest in prowl around a flea market.
sentences.chinese: 漢特對逛跳蚤市場很感興趣。

sentences.english: When their masters go to the flea market.
sentences.chinese: 漢特對逛跳蚤市場很感興趣。

sentences.english: Mr. B has recently come across some rare books at a flea market.
sentences.chinese: 先生最近在跳蚤市場偶而找到幾本罕見的書。

sentences.english: The market soon attracted many athletes, and business went on quite well.
sentences.chinese: 跳蚤市場很快就吸引了大量運動員光顧，生意火爆。

definition: market/store/mall (usually specializing in a particular product category such as furniture)
street stall with goods laid out on the ground
to set up a vendor's stall in the street
lit. a banquet with no empty seats/full house/capacity crowd/standing room only
